gw.api.util

Class AttachableProperty<T,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.util.AttachableProperty<T,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of object that this property can be attached to.
    V - The type of value that this property contains.

    public final class AttachableProperty<T,V>
extends java.lang.Object
    A property that can be dynamically attached to any object instance without modifying that object itself. A single instance of this class represents a property that can be attached to any number of objects. All methods of this class are safe for access by multiple threads. Objects and attached values are always distinguished by reference identity rather than by their Object.equals(java.lang.Object) methods.

    Having attached property values will not in and of itself prevent an object from being eligible for garbage collection. An attached property value will not be eligible for garbage collection unless either (a) the AttachableProperty instance itself becomes eligible for garbage collection or (b) the object that the value is attached to becomes independently eligible for garbage collection. In particular, a reference cycle introduced by attached properties can prevent any objects and values involved in the cycle from being eligible for garbage collection. Additionally, in the rare case that an object becomes eligible for garbage collection and then is made ineligible for garbage collection by its own Object.finalize() method, all of its attached properties will already have been effectively reset(T).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AttachableProperty(V defaultValue)
      Initializes this property with the given default value.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      V get(T object)
      Gets this property's attached value for the given object.
      V reset(T object)
      Resets this property's attached value for the given object to be the default value given in the constructor and returns the previously attached value.
      V set(T object, V newValue)
      Sets this property's attached value for the given object to be the given value and returns the previously attached value.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AttachableProperty

        public AttachableProperty(V defaultValue)
        Initializes this property with the given default value. This property will support null values if and only if the default value is itself null.

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public V set(T object,
             V newValue)
        Sets this property's attached value for the given object to be the given value and returns the previously attached value. The new value may be null only if the default value given in the constructor was null. If no value has previously been attached to the given object via this set method, then the default value given in the constructor is returned.

        Note: The given value should not refer back to the given object, either directly or indirectly. Such a reference cycle may prevent both the object and the value from being eligible for garbage collection.

      • get

        public V get(T object)
        Gets this property's attached value for the given object. If no value has previously been attached to the given object via the set method, then the default value given in the constructor is returned.

      • reset

        public V reset(T object)
        Resets this property's attached value for the given object to be the default value given in the constructor and returns the previously attached value. If no value has previously been attached to the given object via the set method, then the default value given in the constructor is returned.
